meanings.def: any or every; anything or everything
used when you are saying that it does not matter what somebody does or what happens, because the result will be the same
examples: Whatever decision he made I would support it.
You have our support, whatever you decide.

meanings.def: used in questions to express surprise or lack of understanding
used as a reply to tell somebody that you do not care what happens or that you are not interested in what they are talking about
examples: ‘You should try a herbal remedy.’ ‘Yeah, whatever.’

meanings.def: used to say that you do not mind what you do, have, etc. and that anything is acceptable
examples: ‘What would you like to do today?’ ‘Whatever.’

meanings.def: or something of a similar type
examples: It's the same in any situation: in a prison, hospital or whatever.

meanings.def: used to warn somebody not to do something under any circumstances
examples: Don't tell Paul, whatever you do!

meanings.def: used to agree to somebody’s suggestion because you do not want to argue

idioms.def: or something of a similar type
examples: It's the same in any situation: in a prison, hospital or whatever.

idioms.def: used to warn somebody not to do something under any circumstances
examples: Don't tell Paul, whatever you do!

idioms.def: used to agree to somebody’s suggestion because you do not want to argue

meanings.def: not at all; not of any kind
examples: ‘Is there any doubt about it?’ ‘None whatsoever.’

meanings.def: used to say that it does not matter what somebody does, or what happens, because the result will be the same
examples: We told him we'd back him whatever.
